text: Stella Stevens (born Estelle Eggleston; October 1, 1938 - February 17, 2023) was an American actress and model. She is known for her roles in Girls! Girls! Girls! (1962), The Nutty Professor (1963), The Courtship of Eddie's Father (1963), The Silencers (1966), Where Angels Go, Trouble Follows (1968), The Ballad of Cable Hogue (1970) and The Poseidon Adventure (1972). In 1960, she won a Golden Globe Award for New Star of the Year â€“ Actress for her role in Say One for Me. Stevens was born in Yazoo City, Mississippi, but raised in Memphis, Tennessee. She studied at Memphis State College. During the 1960s she was one of the most photographed women in the world. In the 1970s, she bought a home near the Cascade Range in Washington state. Stevens died from Alzheimer's disease in Los Angeles, California at the age of 84 years. ==References== ==Other websites== * for Stella Stevens * * * Category:Golden Globe Award winning actors Category:1938 births Category:2023 deaths Category:Deaths from Alzheimer's disease Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:American stage actors Category:American voice actors Category:American models Category:American movie directors Category:American movie producers Category:Businesspeople from Mississippi Category:Businesspeople from Memphis, Tennessee Category:Businesspeople from Washington (state) Category:American artists Category:Actors from Mississippi Category:People from Yazoo City, Mississippi Category:Actors from Memphis, Tennessee Category:Actors from Washington (state)
title: Stella Stevens
